chapter.name: MaxScore: Proportional Notation
chapter.parent: MaxScore: Exporting to SVG and PDF
chapter.p: MaxScore is capable of toggling between displaying standard and proportional notation. In proportional notation, scores are being scrolled rather than displayed page by page when played back. Upon sending the "setProportionalNotation 1" message, MaxScore calculates the total length of score to be displayed on one page as well as the width of each measure taking its tempo and time signature into consideration. The duration of every event (note/interval) including the events that are tied to them is indicated by a line that extends from the notehead. Tied events will be hidden and shown again when the message "setProportionalNotation 0" is sent.

As scrolling scrolling scores can become quite wide, occasionally up to several 10000 pixels, the "canvas autoadjust 0" message prevents the canvas to resize to the dimension of the score; instead scroll bars can be used to navigate to hidden parts of the score.
